SEARCH
Package main

Class UI

java.lang.Object
main.UI
All Implemented Interfaces:
Drawable
public class UI extends Object implements Drawable
This class represents the user interface (UI) for the game. It includes methods for drawing various screens such as the title screen, status screen, dialogue screen, and combat screen.

      public int getXforCenterText(String text)
      Calculates the X-coordinate for centering text on the screen.
      Parameters:
      text - The text for which the X-coordinate is calculated.
      Returns:
      The X-coordinate for centering the text.

    • getXforAlignToRightText

      public int getXforAlignToRightText(String text, int tailX)
      Calculates the X-coordinate for aligning text to the right.
      Parameters:
      text - The text for which the X-coordinate is calculated.
      tailX - The tail X-coordinate to align the text to.
      Returns:
      The X-coordinate for aligning the text to the right.

      Returns:

    • drawMessage

      public void drawMessage()
      Draws the current game message on the screen.

    • drawCombatMessage

      public void drawCombatMessage()
      Draws combat messages on the screen. Each message is displayed with a gradual fade-out effect. Messages are removed from the display after reaching a certain duration.

    • drawLevelupScreen

      public void drawLevelupScreen()
      Draws the level-up screen, allowing the player to allocate stat points after leveling up.

    • draw

      public void draw(Graphics2D g2)
      Draws the graphical elements based on the current game state, including title screens, messages, dialogue screens, player menus, status screens, inventory screens, combat screens, negotiation screens, negotiation reward screens, level-up screens, options screens, and more.
      Specified by:
      draw in interface Drawable
      Parameters:
      g2 - The Graphics2D object used for drawing.

    • drawOptionsScreen

      public void drawOptionsScreen()
      Draws the game options screen, providing access to settings such as full screen, music volume, and sound effects volume.

    • options_top

      public void options_top(int frameX, int frameY)
      Draws the top-level options screen, including settings for full screen, music, sound effects, controls, and quitting the game.
      Parameters:
      frameX - The X-coordinate of the frame.
      frameY - The Y-coordinate of the frame.

    • options_fullScreenNotification

      public void options_fullScreenNotification(int frameX, int frameY)

      Parameters:
      frameX - The X-coordinate of the frame.
      frameY - The Y-coordinate of the frame.
